intro: Unona violacea, commonly known as the violet wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is known for its succulent stems and leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Unona violacea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
